data.message: guess what happens in windows  , now i wonder what will happen if chrome have a calling plugin ,and why does windows detect that as a skype file type  :D
Mohamed Abdel Aty That's because Skype is the tel URI Scheme handler on your machine
Mohamed Abdel Aty Most probably Skype registers itself as a handler for the tel:// protocol.

Luckily Windows Phone always asks the user before making the call :)
I remember there was a similar exploit with Android too (tel links) and they fixed it in a later update!
It's surprising that not many people know aboiut custom Uri Schemes, it's a very useful feature (like file extensions, but for the web!) and can lead to very interesting scenarios like pressing a link to open Skype (as mentioned here) or pressing on a torrent magnet link to automatically launch your torrent client or pressing on link to open your Bitcoin client asking you to confirm a payment. It's also one of the few ways in Windows Phone to make apps launch other apps.
But just like any convenient feature it comes with it's security problems, in this case any app that assigns itself to a Uri Scheme should always ask the user for confirmation :)

Great !...I'm ready for cheating my friends & get some credits for free !
 *868*mobile number*amount#
The USSD dial needs a user confirmation :D
Sure? its not in Android ! (الفرحة متكملش)
